thread.title: Emma Stone Reacts to 'Moonlight' Winning Best Picture Over 'La La Land'
thread.title_full: Emma Stone Reacts to 'Moonlight' Winning Best Picture Over 'La La Land'

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Emma Stone Reacts to 'Moonlight' Winning Best Picture Over 'La La Land'
text:
La La Land 's winning streak came to a harsh and surprising end at at the Academy Awards tonight when Moonlight took home the Oscar for Best Picture, after Damien Chazelle's modern musical received the award first.
Emma Stone, who won the Oscar for Best Actress, was on stage when the whole flub happened, and this was her initial reaction when she first found out the real results:
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below When Emma Stone realizes the twist ending #Oscars #BestPicture pic.twitter.com/nkm1nDLnmE
— Marion Maitland (@nadatostada) February 27, 2017 But after overcoming the initial shock, she had some serious praise to give Barry Jenkins' drama backstage:
Emma Stone backstage said SHE HAD HER CARD THE WHOLE TIME!!! pic.twitter.com/WecMyquaGp
— Marc (@MarcSnetiker) February 27, 2017 "I fucking loved Moonlight ," Stone told a reporter at Entertainment Weekly . "God, I love Moonlight so much! I'm so excited for Moonlight ! And of course, it was an amazing thing to hear La La Land . I think we all would have loved to win Best Picture. But we are so excited for Moonlight . I think it's one of the best films of all time. So I was pretty beside myself."
Warren Beatty, who presented the Best Picture award (along with Bonnie and Clyde costar Faye Dunaway) explained on stage that he was given the wrong card. He was apparently holding the Actress in a Leading Role card, which red Stone's name, when he took the stage. Close-up images prove that was right:
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below
Zoomed-in photo of the envelope Warren Beatty was carrying onstage — it was NOT the envelope for best picture. pic.twitter.com/VThHQ8JnT8
— USA TODAY (@USATODAY) February 27, 2017
"Actress in a Leading Role."
Don't blame #WarrenBeatty #Oscars #BestPicture pic.twitter.com/hpVadk1N9n
— Ryan Lavender (@RealLavender) February 27, 2017 But Stone said to reporters backstage that she was holding her Best Actress card: "I also was holding my Best Actress in a Leading Role cared that entire time. So whatever story... I don't mean to start stuff, but whatever story that was, I had that card. So I'm not sure that happened. And I really wanted to talk to you guys first."
Whatever the story was, at least Emma can celebrate her Best Actress win—which we know is real.
From: Harper's BAZAAR
